verses.kjv: Now the children of Israel after their number, to wit, the chief fathers and captains of thousands and hundreds, and their officers that served the king in any matter of the courses, which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, of every course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: Here is the list of Israelite leaders — the heads of families, commanders of units of 1,000 and 100, and their officers — who served the king through the rotating division system. Each division served for 1 month at a time throughout the year, and each division consisted of 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: In charge of the 1st division for the 1st month was Jashobeam son of Zabdiel, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: Of the children of Perez was the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.
verses.ct: He was a descendant of Perez and served as the chief of all the army commanders for the 1st month.

verses.kjv: And over the course of the second month was Dodai an Ahohite, and of his course was Mikloth also the ruler: in his course likewise were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: In charge of the division for the 2nd month was Dodai the Ahohite, with Mikloth as his second-in-command. His division also had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a chief priest: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 3rd army commander for the 3rd month was Benaiah son of Jehoiada the chief priest, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: This is that Benaiah, who was mighty among the thirty, and above the thirty: and in his course was Ammizabad his son.
verses.ct: This was the same Benaiah who was a warrior among the 30 elite fighters and ranked above them. His son Ammizabad served in his division.

verses.kjv: The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 4th commander for the 4th month was Asahel, Joab's brother, and after him his son Zebadiah took over. His division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 5th commander for the 5th month was Shamhuth the Izrahite, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 6th commander for the 6th month was Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 7th commander for the 7th month was Helez the Pelonite, from the descendants of Ephraim, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 8th commander for the 8th month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, from the Zarhites, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anetothite, of the Benjamites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 9th commander for the 9th month was Abiezer the Anetothite, from the tribe of Benjamin, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 10th commander for the 10th month was Maharai the Netophathite, from the Zarhites, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 11th commander for the 11th month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, from the descendants of Ephraim, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.
verses.ct: The 12th commander for the 12th month was Heldai the Netophathite, a descendant of Othniel, and his division had 24,000 men.

verses.kjv: Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: the ruler of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri: of the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah:
verses.ct: As for the tribal leaders of Israel: over the Reubenites was Eliezer son of Zichri; over the Simeonites was Shephatiah son of Maachah;

verses.kjv: Of the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel: of the Aaronites, Zadok:
verses.ct: over the Levites was Hashabiah son of Kemuel; over the descendants of Aaron was Zadok;

verses.kjv: Of Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David: of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael:
verses.ct: over Judah was Elihu, one of David's brothers; over Issachar was Omri son of Michael;

verses.kjv: Of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah: of Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel:
verses.ct: over Zebulun was Ishmaiah son of Obadiah; over Naphtali was Jerimoth son of Azriel;

verses.kjv: Of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah: of the half tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah:
verses.ct: over the descendants of Ephraim was Hoshea son of Azaziah; over the half-tribe of Manasseh was Joel son of Pedaiah;

verses.kjv: Of the half tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah: of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner:
verses.ct: over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead was Iddo son of Zechariah; over Benjamin was Jaasiel son of Abner;

verses.kjv: Of Dan, Azareel the son of Jeroham. These were the princes of the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: over Dan was Azareel son of Jeroham. These were the leaders of Israel's tribes.

verses.kjv: But David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under: because the LORD had said he would increase Israel like to the stars of the heavens.
verses.ct: David did not count those who were 20 years old or younger, because the LORD had promised to make Israel as numerous as the stars in the heavens.

verses.kjv: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number, but he finished not, because there fell wrath for it against Israel; neither was the number put in the account of the chronicles of king David.
verses.ct: Joab son of Zeruiah started taking a census but never completed it, because God's anger fell on Israel because of it. The final count was never recorded in the official records of King David.

verses.kjv: And over the king’s treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the castles, was Jehonathan the son of Uzziah:
verses.ct: Azmaveth son of Adiel was in charge of the royal treasuries. Jehonathan son of Uzziah oversaw the storehouses throughout the countryside — in the towns, villages, and fortresses.

verses.kjv: And over them that did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub:
verses.ct: Ezri son of Chelub supervised the workers who farmed the land.

verses.kjv: And over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite: over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite:
verses.ct: Shimei the Ramathite managed the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was responsible for the wine production and storage from those vineyards.

verses.kjv: And over the olive trees and the sycomore trees that were in the low plains was Baalhanan the Gederite: and over the cellars of oil was Joash:
verses.ct: Baalhanan the Gederite oversaw the olive trees and sycamore trees in the western foothills, and Joash was in charge of the olive oil supplies.

verses.kjv: And over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:
verses.ct: Shitrai the Sharonite managed the cattle grazing in Sharon, and Shaphat son of Adlai was responsible for the herds in the valleys.

verses.kjv: Over the camels also was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite:
verses.ct: Obil the Ishmaelite was in charge of the camels, and Jehdeiah the Meronothite managed the donkeys.

verses.kjv: And over the flocks was Jaziz the Hagerite. All these were the rulers of the substance which was king David’s.
verses.ct: Jaziz the Hagerite oversaw the flocks. All of these men were the administrators of King David's property.

verses.kjv: Also Jonathan David’s uncle was a counsellor, a wise man, and a scribe: and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was with the king’s sons:
verses.ct: Jonathan, David's uncle, served as a counselor — he was a wise and educated man. Jehiel son of Hachmoni was the tutor of the king's sons.

verses.kjv: And Ahithophel was the king’s counsellor: and Hushai the Archite was the king’s companion:
verses.ct: Ahithophel served as the king's advisor, and Hushai the Archite was the king's close friend.

verses.kjv: And after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar: and the general of the king’s army was Joab.
verses.ct: After Ahithophel, his role was filled by Jehoiada son of Benaiah, along with Abiathar. Joab served as the commander of the king's army.
